main event: An observer sighted a round red object with a large tail, which was likely the result of satellite debris decaying in the atmosphere on March 15, 1955.
interesting points: The object was first seen in the south and disappeared in the southeast,The observer reported the object had a large fiery tail,The event was likely due to the decay of satellites according to Project Blue Book,The observer witnessed this phenomenon unaided and through binoculars,The report includes a follow-up from the Air Force confirming the object's probable identification as satellite debris.
sighted object: a round red object with a fiery tail
